raw_text:
Barcelona title hopes hit by loss
 
 Barcelona's pursuit of the Spanish title took a blow on Sunday as they fell to a 2-0 defeat at home to Atletico Madrid.
 
 Fernando Torres gave Athletico an ideal start with a goal in the first minute. Ronaldino wasted a second-half chance to equalise for Barca when he put a penalty wide, but Torres made no such mistake with a last-minute spot-kick. The defeat, coupled with Real Madrid's 4-0 win over Espanyol on Saturday, reduces Barca's lead to four points. Former Everton midfielder Thomas Gravesen scored his first goal for Real in the comfortable victory at the Bernabeu. Zinedine Zidane had opened the scoring before Raul bagged a brace. Gravesen, who replaced Zidane, completed the scoring in the 84th minute with a low shot. David Beckham, watched by Sven-Goran Eriksson, came off in the 67th minute with a shoulder injury but should be fit for England's game against Holland. England team-mate Michael Owen came on for Raul after 76 minutes with the game already won. Real have now won six consecutive Primera Liga games since coach Wanderley Luxemburgo took charge.
llama3.2:1b: Barcelona suffered a 2-0 loss to Atletico Madrid, reducing their lead in the Spanish title race to four points. The defeat came despite Fernando Torres scoring an early goal and providing two other chances for his team to equalize. Real Madrid won 4-0 against Espanyol on Saturday, further stretching Barca's deficit.
llama3.2:3b: Barcelona suffered a 2-0 loss at home to Atletico Madrid, reducing their lead in the Spanish title race to four points. Fernando Torres scored twice for Atletico, including a late penalty, while Ronaldinho missed a second-half penalty chance for Barcelona. Real Madrid won 4-0 against Espanyol, with Thomas Gravesen scoring his first goal and David Beckham expected to be fit for England's match against Holland.
gemma2:2b: Barcelona lost to Atletico Madrid 2-0, dropping four points behind Real Madrid who won 4-0 against Espanyol.  Thomas Gravesen scored his first goal for Real Madrid in the victory while David Beckham suffered a shoulder injury.  Real now have six consecutive wins under Wanderley Luxemburgo.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Barcelona fell to a 2-0 loss in their domestic Spanish league match against Atletico Madrid, losing five points to the hosts. The defeat reduced Barca's lead to four points and saw former Everton midfielder Thomas Gravesen make his first goal for Real Madrid. David Beckham replaced Zidane but returned after 67 minutes with a shoulder injury, but should be fit for England's match against Holland.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Barcelona loses Spanish title bid, facing reduced lead to fourth-place Atletico Madrid and losing match in Champions League as Real Madrid advances with Thomas Gravesen's goal.
qwen2.5:3b: Barcelona lost 2-0 to Atletico Madrid at home, reducing their lead in La Liga to four points from Real Madrid's 4-0 win over Espanyol. Fernando Torres scored for Atletico in the first minute and completed a last-minute penalty. Former Everton midfielder Thomas Gravesen scored his first goal for Real Madrid against Barcelona, who now trail Real by six points after their defeat.
smollm:1.7b: Barcelona hopes to win the Spanish title by beating Atletico Madrid, but they lost in a 2-0 defeat on Sunday. The team's pursuit of the title was hindered by a loss to Real Madrid, which reduced their lead to four points. Former Everton midfielder Thomas Gravesen scored his first goal for Barcelona in the 84th minute, and Zinedine Zidane completed the scoring with a low shot. David Beckham should be fit for England's game against Holland because he came off in the 67th minute after Raul's injury. The team-mate Michael Owen should come on for Raul because he was already fit for England's game, and the match is now won by Barcelona.
deepseek-r1:1.5b:
<think>
Okay, so I need to summarize this text about Barcelona's loss at Atletico Madrid. Let me read through it again carefully.

Barcelona faced a 2-0 loss to Atletico Madrid at home. Their main threat started with Fernando Torres in the first minute. He scored for Atletico, and then he had an easy goal for them when he missed a penalty but sent a spot kick for a barinate. Barcelona scored their first goal later with Thomas Graveseine who came off for Zidane, and then Zidane had another goal. They also have Zidane scoring before Raul, and Real Madrid's manager, Zidane, is playing well.

He mentioned some injuries, like Zidane missing a game, but he should be fit. Also, David Beckham, replacing Zidane, came off with a shoulder injury. Raul scored for them 76 minutes in, and they've now won six in a row since Luxemburgo took over.

I need to keep only the key points without explanations or formatting. So I'll mention Barcelona's main issues, their coach's performance, the goals scored by different players, and their win streak.
</think>

Barcelona's loss at Atletico Madrid ended a 2-0 defeat. Their key threats started with Fernando Torres, who scored for Atletico in the first minute. Zidane opened the scoring before Raul bagged two goals. The team has won six straight Primera Liga games since coach Wanderley Luxemburgo took over. Real Madrid defeated Espanyol 4-0, and Zidane is injury-free despite missing a game.
tinyllama:1.1b: Barcelona's title hopes were hit by a narrow defeat at home to Atlético Madrid, with Fernando Torre's first goal of the season putting the visitors ahead in the 1st minute. Ronaldinho made no mistake with a penalty attempt but the equalizer came from a set-piece by Thomas Gravesen for Real Madrid, who claimed another four points in their convincing win over Everton's Zinedine Zidane. With David Beckham out injured and Owen replacing him on the bench, Real maintained their stranglehold on the league with a comfortable 2-0 victory at the Bernabeu. Barcelona's lead to four points was now reduced to two after Zidané's first goal for Real Madrid. The match also saw the return of Zidane from injury and the captain picked up a shoulder injury in the 67th minute, but he should be fit for England's game against Holland.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Barcelona's pursuit of the Spanish title experienced a setback on Sunday when they lost 2-0 at home to Atletico Madrid, which means their lead in the league has been cut to four points. This loss comes with some bad luck for Barca as a goal by Fernando Torres put them ahead early in the game but he was unable to convert his opportunity later on. The defeat is also a setback for their Argentine forward, Ronaldinho, who wasted a chance to equalize but managed to score his own penalty kick in the 76th minute. Real Madrid secured their win with two more goals, with David Beckham coming off the bench to replace Raul in the 67th minute and come close with a header but couldn't find the back of the net. England team-mate Michael Owen came on for Raul after 76 minutes and contributed with a goal of his own, which sealed their win against Holland.
phi:2.7b: Barca's pursuit of the Spanish title was hit by a 2-0 defeat at home to Atletico Madrid, as Fernando Torres gave Athletico an ideal start and Ronaldino missed a penalty in the second half. The loss, coupled with Real Madrid's 4-0 win over Espanyol on Saturday, reduces Barca's lead to four points. Zinedine Zidane opened the scoring for Real before Raul bagged two goals. David Beckham came off injured but should be fit for England' s game against Holland. Real have now won six consecutive Primera Liga games under coach Wanderley Luxemburgo.
orca-mini:3b: Barcelona's hopes of winning the Spanish title were dealt a blow as they lost 2-0 to Atletico Madrid, reducing their lead to four points after Real Madrid's 4-0 win over Espanyol on Saturday. Thomas Gravesen scored his first goal for Real in the comfortable victory at the Bernabeu, with Zinedine Zidane and Raul scoring doubles. David Beckham was watched by Sven-Goran Eriksson but came off injured. Michael Owen replaced Raul with the game already won.
hermes3:3b: Barcada title push harmed by 2-0 loss v Atletico, reducing lead to 4 points.

Real Madrid also secured a comfortable victory against Espanyol, with former Everton midfielder Thomas Gravesen scoring his first goal for the team. In other news, David Beckham came off in the 67th minute due to a shoulder injury but is expected to be fit for England's game against Holland.

stablelm2:1.6b: Barcelona's title hopes suffered a defeat as they lost 2-0 to Atletico Madrid, while Real Madrid secured their fourth consecutive win in the Primera Liga with a victory against Espanyol. Athletico's Fernando Torres opened the scoring with a goal in the first minute and completed the scoring from the penalty spot in the last minute. The loss leaves Barcelona four points behind, despite their recent win over Real Madrid.
granite3.1-dense:2b: Barcelona's title race faces challenges after a 2-0 home loss to Atletico Madrid, with Fernando Torres scoring both goals. This defeat, alongside Real Madrid's 4-0 victory over Espanyol, reduced Barca's lead to four points. Real Madrid's goals came from Zinedine Zidane, Raul, and Gravesen, who made his debut with a successful penalty. David Beckham injured his shoulder but is expected to recover for England's match against Holland. Michael Owen replaced Raul in the 76th minute. Real Madrid has won six consecutive Primera Liga games under coach Wanderley Luxemburgo.
reference: Gravesen, who replaced Zidane, completed the scoring in the 84th minute with a low shot.England team-mate Michael Owen came on for Raul after 76 minutes with the game already won.Fernando Torres gave Athletico an ideal start with a goal in the first minute.David Beckham, watched by Sven-Goran Eriksson, came off in the 67th minute with a shoulder injury but should be fit for England's game against Holland.
